interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: The Car Review Date: 2014/10/11 Store: James Brolin (Actor), Elliot Silverstein (Director) Rated: PG Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Horror Product Description: ['Fasten your seatbelts for the terrifying thrill ride that has become a cult classic - The Car! The peaceful tranquility of a small Western town is disturbed when a murderous car wreaks havoc by viciously mowing down innocent victims. New sheriff, Wade Parent (James Brolin), may be the only one who can stop this menace in its tracks until he realizes that the driver of this indestructible vehicle is far more dangerous than any man… it is driven by pure evil. With a digitally remastered picture, The Car has never been more thrilling, more chilling or more explosively entertaining!Bonus Content:', 'Theatrical Trailer', 'Theatrical Trailer'] Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Horror, Suspense, Arthouse', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'James Brolin, Elliot Silverstein', 'Initial release date': '2008-05-06', 'Language': 'French (Dolby Digital 2.0 Mono), English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Stereo), Unqualified (DTS ES 6.1)', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.35:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 0.01 Ounces', 'Item model number': '1103503', 'Director': 'Elliot Silverstein', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 37 minutes', 'Release date': 'May 6, 2008', 'Actors': 'James Brolin', 'Dubbed': 'French', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'Studio Distribution Services', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: This is a review about this version of the disc, not the movie. This 'new' disc sold by Amazon, with no DVD security features on the packaging, has numerous glitches; I suspect it's on all copies of this edition, I bought it new. It pauses momentarily, perhaps makes a sound, and continues. It's done this several times already having started the movie (it's on as I speak). It's widescreen and the picture quality is okay, but my roommate pointed out to me that it's overdubbed, that is the sound isn't always matching the lips; I checked the listing, and sure enough, it says "dubbed". I haven't tried the French-language soundtrack. I already purchased a used copy of a more expensive edition of this film by Anchor Bay. I'll be returning this one. I'm surprised at Amazon for selling an inferior version as new.

--

I received and am playing the disk I referred to [[ASIN:6305511861 The Car]] and when trying to review the Amazon system informed me I have already reviewed the product, being the other disk of inferior condition that wouldn't play. This, of course, is ridiculous. This disk, as I have anticipated, is superior and is playing without a single glitch. It was professionally produced with packaging as a DVD should be. So, definitely get this (ASIN 6305511861) rather than the cheaper disk on Amazon which began this review. Both are Region 1. I bought a used disk which is in better condition than the "new" one sold by Amazon. Neither Region 1 DVD disk of this movie has subtitles. I'm happy with the widescreen version included on the ASIN mentioned. The single caveat of this edition is that the packaging has a definite flaw: the ring that holds the disk continues in a full circle even past the finger indentations, making it impossible to remove the disk easily even when holding down the middle button. You could scratch the disk trying to get it out, I had to hold it upside down and dig with the "button finger". I won't return it to the case. But the disk itself is great, and the one I recommend (Anchor Bay). Too bad it's out of print. Review Title: Glitched. Dubbed. New?? Rating: 1.0 --------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
The Umbrellas of Cherbourg [Korean Import] Catherine deneuve (Actor), Nino Castelnuovo (Actor), Jacques Demy (Director) & 0 more Format: DVD Movies & TV, Movies {'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'Package Dimensions': '7.1 x 5.42 x 0.58 inches; 2.88 Ounces', 'Director': 'Jacques Demy', 'Media Format': 'NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 31 minutes', 'Actors': 'Catherine deneuve, Nino Castelnuovo', 'Subtitles': 'English, Korean', 'Language': 'Unqualified (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround)'} Get the British/European disc with the colored stripes on the cover, not the Korean one which is fullscreen and of bootleggy quality. The Special Edition is widescreen and of good quality like 'The Girls of Rochefort' also available on Amazon. Get Special Edition, not Korean disc. The single caveat of this edition is that the packaging has a definite flaw: the ring that holds the disk continues in a full circle even past the finger indentations, making it impossible to remove the disk easily even when holding down the middle button. But the disk itself is great, and the one I recommend (Anchor Bay). Too bad it's out of print. Glitched. Dubbed. New??
profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Media Preference:** Strong inclination towards classic and international cinema, with a particular interest in cult classics.
- **Quality Consciousness:** Prioritizes high-quality versions of media products, often preferring well-reviewed editions over lesser quality imports.
- **Support for Subtitles:** Shows openness to foreign language films with subtitles, indicating a desire for diverse cinematic experiences.
- **Attention to Packaging and Presentation:** Values aesthetically pleasing and functional packaging, emphasizing the importance of a professional presentation in media formats.
- **Strong Recommendations:** Willing to share insights based on personal experiences, showcasing a knowledgeable stance in film selections, particularly when contrasting different editions of films.
- **Critical Evaluation:** Recently demonstrated a keen eye for detail, providing critical feedback on media products, particularly regarding audio quality, packaging issues, and overall presentation. Displays frustration with inferior products sold as new and shows a preference for reliable sellers and editions.

Overall, the user demonstrates sophisticated taste in films, favoring high-quality, well-presented versions while being critical of subpar offerings in the market.
